page.title: 08ALVINGHAM POTTERY
page.content:
Alvingham Pottery has been open for 18 years and is housed in an old wheelwrights premises.It is the largest employer of local labour in the area other than farming,and usually has three "throwers" and three part-time "decorators"
On the ground floor the public may walk amongst the potters at their wheels as they produce a wide range of household items,from cups to casseroles and table lamps to tea pots.Also on the ground floor are the kilns in which the hand painted and glazed pots are fired. The finished articles,examples of which are on display in the first floor show-room are very popular,not only localy but with many people from all parts of the country.
